intro: Melodinus oblongus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved melodine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and elliptical, dark green leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have a yellowish or greenish hue. Melodinus oblongus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
